question.text: All the following statements are correct, except:

options.text: Retrovirus is commonly used as a vector for introducing a DNA fragment in human lymphocytes.
In India, the organisation responsible for assessing the safety of introducing genetically modified organisms for public use is GEAC.
The correct order of steps in polymerase chain reaction is denaturation, extension and annealing.
The DNA fragments separated on an agarose gel can be visualized after staining with ethidium bromide.

solution.text:
The correct order of steps in polymerase chain reaction is denaturation, annealing and extension.

At high temperature hydrogen bonds between nitrogen bases of two strands of DNA breaks and double stranded DNA separates as single strands, this is known as denaturation. Small DNA primers attaches to the template strand and this is known as annealing. Taq polymerase now adds complementary nucleotides to template, this is called as extension.
